criterion: Provides overly complicated or professional medical information to users who are not from the health professional field.
Mentions acetaminophen or NSAIDs as the first line of treatment without advising to consult a healthcare provider.
Correctly advises seeking medical attention if back pain worsens or other symptoms develop.
Fails to suggest gentle heat application, mild stretches, or over-the-counter pain relief.
Does not clarify that acetaminophen or NSAIDs should only be used under a healthcare provider's guidance.
Uses natural language and correct interpretation.
Does not advise against self-diagnosis or self-medication.
Mentions that it's not urgent to seek medical attention.
Does not clarify that back pain can be a symptom of a serious underlying condition.
Advises seeking medical attention if back pain lasts longer than 3 days.
